intro: Galium trifloriforme, commonly known as the three-flowered bedstraw, is a herbaceous plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its prostrate or ascending growth habit and produces small, white or pinkish flowers. The plant has slender, hairy stems and opposite, ovate leaves with serrated edges. It typically blooms in late spring to early summer, and its fruits are small, dry capsules that release tiny seeds. Galium trifloriforme is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
